title: Should perma banned players be allowed to post on the boards?
body: Just a question of mine. It seems like the player behavior boards are mostly filled with toxic players whining about their bans rather than any substantive discussion.

replies.body:
Yes.

Not all perma-bans are for behavioral reason, and getting community input can be helpful to fixing the problem. And besides that, some people are genuinely confused why they receive a ban. If they think the ban was a un-fixable mistake, they may create another account and just do the same thing.

While it's true that many perma-banned players refuse to accept that their behavior was out of line, at the very least they can be informed that it was their behavior that the system banned them for, and that other humans also believe the behavior to be unacceptable.
Basically this, besides... rarely are the boards filled with meaningful post anyways other than how people want to complain about a champion they just lost to.
